text: wow this slack has over 5000! members now
what is your question about it?
Very nice <@UBT0AHWLD>

:wave: Slack Community!

As many of you know, in the past, this Slack has been a great resource for communication, collaboration, and learning for all. At HubSpot, we not only recognize the value this Slack has been to our platform developers but also take great pride in this community. To keep in line with our Culture Code and continue to look to the long term and Solve for not only our customers but our developers. *We are happy to announce we have invested in our community and upgraded our Slack to a Paid Plan!* So, what does this mean? As always, this Slack instance is not an official support channel of HubSpot, we still recommend reaching out through in-app support or our dedicated forums (<https://community.HubSpot.com/>) if you are looking for support from HubSpot, however, with our upgrade we now get the following:

*We now have access to all our old messages from the beginning of time.* 
From awesome collaborations to stellar ideas and solutions, we now get to view them in all their glory.

*Increased Storage*
Each user now gets 10 GB of storage each, perfect for all those pictures of cats/dogs or code.

*Group Video Calls and Screen Sharing*
We had normal 1-1 voice calling before, but now we have the ability for group collaborations and even screen sharing. 

We have a lot of ideas and planning that we are doing for this slack so stay tuned! Also, if you have any questions, comments, or ideas, please feel free to share them with us as a thread on this message.

Likewise, we now have an official Code of Conduct for our Slack. Please be sure to review this here: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct>
This is awesome! Thanks HubSpot!
Amazing!
Thank you (and everyone) for all the contributions you have made to help make this Slack the great resource it is!
This is great, being able to search entire history yay

<@UQWGKUEN7> Curious, is this through the forms created in HubSpot, or a custom form? I don't see an option for a hidden field related to subscription types, just properties, when building a form in the platform.

<@UKGV272KS> sorry hit enter too early, haha. Youre correct - I was thinking of lifecycle stages and got all excited. But I suppose you could create a property that contains all of the subscription types too. And then just have those properties mapped to custom lists.

<@UQWGKUEN7> Gotcha! Yeah the subscription types are completely separate from lists, so you'd still have to add them somehow to them as the platform won't let you send an email without selecting one. If contacts aren't subscribed to that type, they won't receive the email even if they're on the list you're sending to.
My heart is happy.

Another nice benefit we now have with the paid instance is that of Profile fields (beyond the standard 4 or 5). So feel free to go in and edit your profile on Slack. This should allow us all to get to know each other a little better and connect :slightly_smiling_face:
YEEAAAAHHHHHH!!!!
woo hoo!
History is a nice benefit Holy guacamole!
This is huge. Thanks to everyone on the HubSpot team!

<@UKGV272KS> <@UQWGKUEN7> - I actually found an easier way.  If you edit the "Notice and Consent/Legitimate Interest" in the Form it will take you to where you can add a subscription type to subscribe the user to. No workflow needed!
<@ULBP4M3LK> Ahh! Thanks for the find!
